item.name: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education Subcommittee
Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

summary.text: Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (ESEA) to revise impact aid program requirements for payments to local educational agencies (LEAs) with respect to eligible federally-connected children. Provides, where there are insufficient funds to provide full amounts of such payments to all eligible LEAs, a formula by which amounts in excess of 150 percent of a threshold amount for some LEAs are to be distributed to other LEAs that have not received their full amounts.

bill.title: To amend the impact aid program under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to clarify the formula used to compute payments to local educational agencies with respect to eligible federally connected children.

item.title: To amend the impact aid program under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to clarify the formula used to compute payments to local educational agencies with respect to eligible federally connected children.

To amend the impact aid program under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to clarify the formula used to compute payments to local educational agencies with respect to eligible federally connected children.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
